modules.title: Project Info
paragraph: This project was an exercise in combining as many development ideas I had learned up to this point and put together a fully functional website based on a theme of our own choosing.

The original challenge was presented to us with a base template. It was strictly for adding styled features and working with an existing template. It was pretty bare bones, so I started over and created this version. I added separate pages using URL routing and styled them as needed.

modules.title: Inspiration
paragraph: This project was an exercise in emulating a theme. I like playing video games, specifically I really enjoy horror games. So I researched video game companies that specialize in that genre. I studied them and looked for any similarities and repeated elements.
Most of the sites had some sort of video or animated backgrounds, so I used stock video content for the header on each of the pages.

The Games page features scrolling parallax background images, which was an inspiration from Bloober Team. They also feature links that appear to be oversized buttons with a simple border and no background, which is a style I liked, so I wanted to incorporate that.

The Supermassive Games website tends to show more similarities because the inspiration I drew from that site anchors everything together. I chose a very similar font and very thin font weight. I also emulated the hover underline they have for their header nav bar. The game detail pages also pulled inspiration from Supermassive with the large image that spans across the page.
From Ubisoft, I took inspiration for the footer. The other two sites didn't have much in terms of a built out footer, so I had to widen my search for that piece.
